verses.text_plain: And it came to pass, when Rehoboam had established the kingdom, and had strengthened himself, he forsook the law of the Lord, and all Israel with him.
verses.verse_html: 1And it came to pass, when Rehoboam had established the kingdom, and had strengthened himself, he forsook the law of the Lord, and all Israel with him.

tokens.text: And it came to pass, when Rehoboam

verses.text_plain: And it came to pass, that in the fifth year of king Rehoboam Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem, because they had transgressed against the Lord,
verses.verse_html: 2And it came to pass, that in the fifth year of king Rehoboam Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem, because they had transgressed against the Lord,

verses.text_plain: With twelve hundred chariots, and threescore thousand horsemen: and the people were without number that came with him out of Egypt; the Lubims, the Sukkiims, and the Ethiopians.
verses.verse_html: 3With twelve hundred chariots, and threescore thousand horsemen: and the people were without number that came with him out of Egypt; the Lubims, the Sukkiims, and the Ethiopians.

verses.text_plain: And he took the fenced cities which pertained to Judah, and came to Jerusalem.
verses.verse_html: 4And he took the fenced cities which pertained to Judah, and came to Jerusalem.

verses.text_plain: Then came Shemaiah the prophet to Rehoboam, and to the princes of Judah, that were gathered together to Jerusalem because of Shishak, and said unto them, Thus saith the Lord, Ye have forsaken me, and therefore have I also left you in the hand of Shishak.
verses.verse_html: 5Then came Shemaiah the prophet to Rehoboam, and to the princes of Judah, that were gathered together to Jerusalem because of Shishak, and said unto them, Thus saith the Lord, Ye have forsaken me, and therefore have I also left you in the hand of Shishak.

tokens.text: me, and therefore have I also

verses.text_plain: Whereupon the princes of Israel and the king humbled themselves; and they said, The Lord is righteous.
verses.verse_html: 6Whereupon the princes of Israel and the king humbled themselves; and they said, The Lord is righteous.

verses.text_plain: And when the Lord saw that they humbled themselves, the word of the Lord came to Shemaiah, saying, They have humbled themselves; therefore I will not destroy them, but I will grant them some deliverance; and my wrath shall not be poured out upon Jerusalem by the hand of Shishak.
verses.verse_html:
7And when the Lord saw that they humbled themselves, the word of the Lord came to Shemaiah, saying, They have humbled themselves; therefore I will not destroy them, but I will grant them some deliverance; and my wrath shall not be poured out upon Jerusalem by the hand of Shishak.
 some: or, a little while

footnotes.body_html: some: or, a little while

verses.text_plain: Nevertheless they shall be his servants; that they may know my service, and the service of the kingdoms of the countries.
verses.verse_html: 8Nevertheless they shall be his servants; that they may know my service, and the service of the kingdoms of the countries.

tokens.text: Nevertheless they shall be his servants

verses.text_plain: So Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem, and took away the treasures of the house of the Lord, and the treasures of the kings house; he took all: he carried away also the shields of gold which Solomon had made.
verses.verse_html: 9So Shishak king of Egypt came up against Jerusalem, and took away the treasures of the house of the Lord, and the treasures of the kings house; he took all: he carried away also the shields of gold which Solomon had made.

verses.text_plain: Instead of which king Rehoboam made shields of brass, and committed them to the hands of the chief of the guard, that kept the entrance of the kings house.
verses.verse_html: 10Instead of which king Rehoboam made shields of brass, and committed them to the hands of the chief of the guard, that kept the entrance of the kings house.

verses.text_plain: And when the king entered into the house of the Lord, the guard came and fetched them, and brought them again into the guard chamber.
verses.verse_html: 11And when the king entered into the house of the Lord, the guard came and fetched them, and brought them again into the guard chamber.

verses.text_plain: And when he humbled himself, the wrath of the Lord turned from him, that he would not destroy him altogether: and also in Judah things went well.
verses.verse_html:
12And when he humbled himself, the wrath of the Lord turned from him, that he would not destroy him altogether: and also in Judah things went well.
 and also: or, and yet in Judah there were good things

tokens.text: from him, that he would not destroy

footnotes.body_text: and also: or, and yet in Judah there were good things
footnotes.body_html: and also: or, and yet in Judah there were good things

verses.text_plain: So king Rehoboam strengthened himself in Jerusalem, and reigned: for Rehoboam was one and forty years old when he began to reign, and he reigned seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city which the Lord had chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, to put his name there. And his mothers name was Naamah an Ammonitess.
verses.verse_html: 13So king Rehoboam strengthened himself in Jerusalem, and reigned: for Rehoboam was one and forty years old when he began to reign, and he reigned seventeen years in Jerusalem, the city which the Lord had chosen out of all the tribes of Israel, to put his name there. And his mothers name was Naamah an Ammonitess.

verses.text_plain: And he did evil, because he prepared not his heart to seek the Lord.
verses.verse_html:
14And he did evil, because he prepared not his heart to seek the Lord.
 prepared: or, fixed

verses.text_plain: Now the acts of Rehoboam, first and last, are they not written in the book of Shemaiah the prophet, and of Iddo the seer concerning genealogies? And there were wars between Rehoboam and Jeroboam continually.
verses.verse_html:
15Now the acts of Rehoboam, first and last, are they not written in the book of Shemaiah the prophet, and of Iddo the seer concerning genealogies? And there were wars between Rehoboam and Jeroboam continually.
 book: Heb. words

verses.text_plain: And Rehoboam slept with his fathers, and was buried in the city of David: and Abijah his son reigned in his stead.
verses.verse_html:
16And Rehoboam slept with his fathers, and was buried in the city of David: and Abijah his son reigned in his stead.
 Abijah: also called, Abijam

footnotes.body_html: Abijah: also called, Abijam
